questions.text: A microbiology resident is lecturing on Corynebacterium diphtheriae. She asks the residents which of the following statements regarding the bacterium and its toxin is accurate?

options.label: A
options.text: Every strain of Corynebacterium diphtheriae produces the diphtheria toxin.

options.label: B
options.text: The production of diphtheria toxin is dependent upon the environmental concentration of iron.

options.label: C
options.text: The gene for diphtheria toxin production is plasmid-borne.

options.label: D
options.text: The diphtheria toxin inhibits cyclic AMP (cAMP) production.

questions.explanation:
Ans. B) The production of diphtheria toxin is dependent upon the environmental concentration of iron.

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Option A: Not all strains produce the toxin ; only those infected with a bacteriophage that carries the tox gene can produce the diphtheria toxin.
  • • Option A:
  • • Not all strains produce the toxin
  • • Option C: The diphtheria toxin gene (tox) is not plasmid-borne; it is carried by a lysogenic bacteriophage integrated into the bacterium's genome.
  • • Option C:
  • • diphtheria toxin gene
  • • not plasmid-borne;
  • • Option D: The diphtheria toxin does not inhibit cAMP production; it inhibits protein synthesis by inactivating EF-2.
  • • Option D:
  • • diphtheria toxin does not inhibit cAMP production;

Educational Objective:

Fragment A is internalized into host cells, where it ADP ribosylates elongation factor 2 (EF2). Inhibition of EF2 leads to irreversible inhibition of protein synthesis, resulting in cell death.

questions.text: A 60-year-old man with multiple comorbidities is admitted to a hospital ward where an outbreak of MRSA has been reported. As part of the infection control team, you are tasked with implementing the most effective measure to control the spread of MRSA. Which of the following is the most appropriate initial step?

options.text: Prophylactic administration of vancomycin to all patients

options.label: C
options.text: Mandating the use of masks before invasive procedures

options.label: D
options.text: Ensuring rigorous hand hygiene before and after patient contact

questions.correct_answer: D. Ensuring rigorous hand hygiene before and after patient contact
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Ensuring rigorous hand hygiene before and after patient contact

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Option A: Prophylactic administration of vancomycin to all patients - This is not the most appropriate initial step for controlling MRSA. Prophylactic use of antibiotics should be reserved for specific clinical indications and should not be used as a routine measure for infection control due to the risk of antibiotic resistance.

  • • Prophylactic use of antibiotics
  • • reserved for specific clinical indications
  • • Option B: Regular fumigation of the ward - Fumigation may help control some pathogens , but it is not the most effective initial step for controlling MRSA. Direct hand and surface contact are more common routes of transmission for MRSA.
  • • Option B: Regular fumigation of the ward -
  • • Fumigation may help control some pathogens
  • • Option C: Mandating the use of masks before invasive procedures - While the use of masks is important for preventing the spread of infections during invasive procedures , it is not the most appropriate initial step in controlling MRSA. Hand hygiene is a more fundamental measure.
  • • Option C: Mandating the use of masks before invasive procedures -
  • • use of masks is important for preventing the spread of infections during invasive procedures
